summary: This is a legal memorandum filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, supporting a motion to strike references to 'Accuser-3' from the superseding indictment. The defense argues the allegations regarding Accuser-3 are irrelevant, prejudicial, and insufficient to support the charged conspiracies under the Mann Act, as they involve no alleged travel and the accuser was above the age of consent in England.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant charged with conspiring to violate the Mann Act by enticing minors to travel for unlawful sexual activity with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier alleged to have sexually abused minors; Maxwell is accused of conspiring with him and facilitating his abuse.

persons.name: Accuser-1
persons.context: Also referred to as Minor Victim-1; the individual as to whom Maxwell is charged with substantive Mann Act violations involving travel from Florida to New York.

persons.name: Accuser-2
persons.context: Also referred to as Minor Victim-2; an individual mentioned in the indictment whose allegations are part of the conspiracy counts.

persons.name: Accuser-3
persons.context: Also referred to as Minor Victim-3; an individual allegedly groomed by Maxwell in London in 1994-1995, introduced to Epstein, and sexually abused. The defense argues these allegations are surplusage.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Cohen & Gresser LLP, signatory to the memorandum.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Cohen & Gresser LLP, signatory to the certificate of service.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired to violate the Mann Act by enticing and transporting minors for unlawful sexual activity.
Maxwell is charged with substantively enticing and causing Accuser-1 to travel from Florida to New York to engage in sex acts with Epstein.
Alleged to have groomed and befriended Accuser-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged massages knowing Epstein would engage in sex acts.
Alleged to have sexually abused Accuser-3 during massages arranged by Maxwell in London.
Lead defense attorney representing Maxwell in the criminal case.

events.title: Alleged Conspiracy Period
events.description: The period during which Maxwell is alleged to have conspired with Epstein to violate the Mann Act by enticing minors to travel for unlawful sexual activity.

events.title: Grooming of Accuser-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell allegedly groomed and befriended Accuser-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and arranged interactions where Epstein sexually abused her.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Strike Surplusage
events.description: Maxwell's defense files this memorandum supporting a motion to strike all references to Accuser-3 from the superseding indictment.

keyFacts: The defense argues allegations regarding Accuser-3 are surplusage because the indictment contains no allegation that Accuser-3 ever traveled, which is a core element of the Mann Act charges.

Accuser-3 was above the legal age of consent in England (16) during all alleged interactions (1994-1995), and the indictment does not allege the sexual activity was nonconsensual or violated English law.
The defense contends the statute of limitations for any offense involving Accuser-3 expired in March 2002 when she turned 25, making prosecution time-barred.

The memorandum characterizes the government's inclusion of Accuser-3 allegations as a prejudicial attempt to introduce 'other acts' evidence that should be governed by Federal Rule of Evidence 404(b).
The filing reveals Accuser-3 was born in March 1977, as disclosed by the government.
